metadata.title: CVE-2022-1486 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 101.0.4951.41 allowed aremote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from processmemory via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.4951.64-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
